verses.verse: Then it came about when Jesus had finished these instructions to his twelve disciples, he left there to teach and preach in their cities.
Now when John heard in prison about the works of Christ, he sent two of his disciples.
And said to him, "Are you the Coming One or do look for another?
Jesus answered and said, "Go and tell John again those things which you see and hear:
"The blind receive their sight and the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed and the deaf hear, the dead are raised and the poor have the gospel preached to them.
"Blessed is he who doesn't stumble because of me".
As they left, Jesus started talking to the crowd about John, "What did you go out to see in the wilderness, a reed shaking in the wind?
"But what did you go out to see? A man dressed in soft clothes? Look, those who wear soft clothes are in king's houses.
"But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, even more than a prophet.
"For this is about whom it is written: Behold, I send my messenger before your face who will prepare your way before you.
"Truly, I say to you: Among those born of women, there has not risen any greater than John the Baptist, nevertheless he who is least in the Kingdom of Heaven is greater than he.
"And from the days of John the Baptist until now the Kingdom of Heaven suffers violence and the violent are seizing it.
"For all the prophets and the law prophesied up through John.
"And if you will receive it, this is Elijah, who was to come.
"He who has ears to hear better hear.
"But to what will I compare this generation to? It is like children sitting in the markets and calling out to their friends,
saying: «We played flutes for you, yet you haven't danced. We have mourned for you, yet you haven't acted as you mourned.
"For John came neither eating or drinking, and they say, «He has a devil.»
"The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and they say: «Look, a glutton and wino, a friend of tax collectors and sinner.» But wisdom is justified by her children."
Then he started to severely rebuke the cities where most of his mighty works were done, because they did not repent.
"Woe to you, Chorzain, woe to Bethsaida! If the mighty works, which were done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.
"But I say to you: «It will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon in the Day of Judgment than for you.
"And you, Capernaum, who are exalted to heaven, will be brought down to hell, for if the mighty works which were done i:n you had been done in Sodom, it would have remained to this day.
"But I say to you: «That it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom in the Day of Judgment than for you".
At that time Jesus started to talk, saying, "I thank you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you have hid these thing from the experts and the learned and has revealed them to the unlearned.
"Even so, Father, for so it seemed good in your sight.
"All things are given to me by my Father, and no one fully knows the Son except the Father, neither does anyone fully know the Father except the Son and to whoever the Son is willing to reveal him.
"Come to me, all who are exhausted and burdened, and I will give you rest.
"Take my yoke on you and learn from me, for I am not overbearing, I am lowly in heart, and you will find rest for your souls.
"For my yoke is easy to bear, and my burden is light."
